definition: bucket/(trash) can/barrel (of oil etc)/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
path screened by walls on both sides
the Yongjiang river 甬江[Yong3 jiang1] through Ningbo 寧波|宁波[Ning2 bo1]/abbr. for Ningbo
variant of 桶[tong3], bucket/(classifier) cubic dry measure (5 pecks 五斗, approx half-liter)
chamber pot/wooden pan used as toilet/toilet bowl
rubbish bin/trash can/garbage can/Taiwan pr. [le4 se4 tong3]
rice tub (from which cooked rice or other food is served)/(fig.) fathead/a good-for-nothing
(coll.) (of one's skills, knowledge etc) limited/superficial/half-baked/sb with a smattering of knowledge (of sth)/dabbler
to shoot fish in a barrel/to attempt sth too easy

sentences.english: These substances leak from the rusty barrels and pollute soil.
sentences.chinese: 這些物質從生鏽的桶中滲出然後污染了土壤。

sentences.english: The barrel was nearly empty and I had to climb right inside to get my apple.
sentences.chinese: 蘋果桶快空了，我只好鑽進去拿蘋果。

sentences.english: The girl was bucketing water from the well.
sentences.chinese: 那姑娘在用桶從井裏打水。

sentences.english: The company's production from the 22 producing concessions last year totaled over 51, 000 barrels of oil equivalent per day.
sentences.chinese: 公司去年22個產區平均每天產5萬一千桶石油。

sentences.english: Five million barrels of oil gushed into the ocean over 86 straight days.
sentences.chinese: 約有5百萬桶石油在足足86天內泄入大海。

sentences.english: Then it flew to the butter-cask and down into the meal-tub and out again.
sentences.chinese: 然後，它飛到了酥油桶又下到喫飯浴缸和出來。

sentences.english: Wang and his roommates used 10 buckets of water to fill the inflatable pool.
sentences.chinese: 王曉星和室友們用了10桶水才把充氣泳池填滿。

sentences.english: The tap on the cask was dirty.

sentences.chinese: 你不可能得到更大的桶。

sentences.english: Well, it takes a lot of pails of sap to make one pail of syrup.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，需要很多桶的糖樹汁才能釀一桶楓蜜。

sentences.english: The residents of Kiev didn’t even know they lived on a “powder keg”.
sentences.chinese: 基輔的居民並不知道他們正住在“炸藥桶”上。

sentences.english: Because the salary is based on the number of barrels of water transport to pay.
sentences.chinese: 因爲它的薪酬是根據運水的桶數來支付的。

sentences.english: Stolte looks around the room and sees the bucket on the floor.
sentences.chinese: Stolte在室內巡視了一番，看見在地上有個桶。

sentences.english: This bottom of bucket has worn through.
Angling a tom slightly causes sound waves to scatter, and diffuses them.
sentences.chinese: 輕微調節落地桶鼓的擺放角度使聲波散射和漫反射。

sentences.english: Six pails full, and see that it's good and hot.
sentences.chinese: 六個桶都裝滿，又好又熱。
